segments.text: Hi , Larry , how was your weekend ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Not bad . We had a get-together with friends from college . I haven't seen many of them since graduation . How about you ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Great . I hung out with Jo all day shopping , and the went out for dinner together .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sounds a good weekend . You know it always amazes me that two people as different as you and Jo can become such close friends .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yeah , I never thought we could be good friends either . We have our differences . She's more outgoing and active while I am more quiet and reversed , but we still get along extremely well . We can talk for hours about anything .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's great . I know people who can't stand each other for even five minutes .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: When Jo and I are together , we argue a lot , but that's also part of the fun . Besides , I know she will always be there for me when I need her , and she knows I'll be there for her .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It seems you two bring out the best of one another .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Exactly . Having Jo as my friend is one of the best things that's ever happened to me .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah , you are so lucky to have found each other .
segments.speaker: S2
